do
    write(*, *)
    
contains
    ! Function finds the position of the first element >= target
    integer function find_first_ge(arr, cnt, target) result (pos)
        integer, intent(in) :: arr(:), cnt, target
        integer :: low, high, mid
        pos = -1
        low = 1
        high = cnt
        do while (low <= high)
            mid = (low + high) /2
            if (arr(mid) >= target) then
                pos = mid
                high = mid -1
            else
                low = mid +1
            end if
        end do
    end function find_first_ge
    
    ! Function finds the position of the last element <= target
    integer function find_last_le(arr, cnt, target) result(pos)
        integer, intent(in) :: arr(:), cnt, target
        integer :: low, high, mid
        pos = -1
        low =1
        high = cnt
        do while (low <= high)
            mid = (low + high) /2
            if (arr(mid) <= target) then
                pos = mid
                low = mid +1
            else
                high = mid-1
            end if
        end do
    end function find_last_le
    
    ! Function to find the insertion position for a value
    integer function find_insert_pos(arr, cnt, val) result(pos)
        integer, intent(in) :: arr(:), cnt, val
        integer :: low, high, mid
        pos = cnt +1
        low =1
        high = cnt
        do while (low <= high) mid = (low + high)/2
            if (arr(mid) <= val) then
                low = mid +1
            else
                pos = mid
                high = mid -1
            end if
        end do
    end function find_insert_pos
end program code_356A

program code_356A
    implicit none
    
    integer :: n, q, l_input, r_input, win_val, win_idx
    integer, allocatable :: elements(:), answer(:)
    integer :: current_count, i
    integer :: L, R, start_pos, end_pos, new_count
    logical :: found

    ! Read input n and q
    read*, n, q
    allocate(elements(n))
    elements = [(i-1, i = 1, n)]  ! initialized to 0..n-1
    current_count = n
    allocate(answer(0:n-1))  ! 0-based indices stored in 0 to n-1
    answer = 0  ! initializing all answers to 0

    do i = 1, q
        read*, l_input, r_input, win_val
        L = l_input - 1   ! convert to 0-based
        R = r_input -1
        win_idx = win_val -1  ! 0-based
        
        ! Find first element >= L
        start_pos = find_first_ge(elements, current_count, L)
        if (start_pos == -1 .or. elements(start_pos) > R) cycle  ! No elements in range
        
        ! Find last element <= R
        end_pos = find_last_le(elements, current_count, R)
        if (end_pos < start_pos) cycle  ! No valid elements
        
        ! Process the answered array
        do j = start_pos, end_pos
            answer(elements(j)) = win_val
        enddo
        
        ! Remove elements from start_pos to end_pos
        new_count = current_count - (end_pos - start_pos + 1)
        ! Create temporary array excluding the removed elements
        allocate(elements(:new_count) :: temp_elements)
        temp_elements = 0
        
        integer :: k = 0
        do j = 1, start_pos -1
            k = k +1
            temp_elements(k) = elements(j)
        end do
        do j = end_pos +1, current_count
            k = k +1
            temp_elements(k) = elements(j)
        end do
        deallocate(elements)
        elements => temp_elements
        current_count = new_count
        
        ! Set answer for win_idx to 0 and add back to elements
        answer(win_idx) = 0
        
        ! Find insertion position for win_idx

        ! Allocate new array with one more element
        allocate(elements(:current_count +1), source=elements)  ! Initial copy
        shift elements after insert_pos:
        do j = current_count, insert_pos, -1
            elements(j+1) = elements(j)  ! shift right
        end do
        elements(insert_pos) = win_idx
        current_count = current_count + 1
    end do

    ! Output the answer
    do i = 0, n-1
        write(*, '(I0)', advance='no') answer(i)
    end do

contains
    ! Function finds the position of the first element >= target
    integer function find_first_ge(arr, cnt, target) result (pos)
        integer, intent(in) :: arr(:), cnt, target
        integer :: low, high, mid
        pos = -1
        low = 1
        high = cnt
        do while (low <= high)
            mid = (low + high) /2
            if (arr(mid) >= target) then
                pos = mid
                high = mid -1
            else
                low = mid +1
            end if
        end do
    end function find_first_ge
    
    ! Function finds the position of the last element <= target
    integer function find_last_le(arr, cnt, target) result(pos)
        integer, intent(in) :: arr(:), cnt, target
        integer :: low, high, mid
        pos = -1
        low =1
        high = cnt
        do while (low <= high)
            mid = (low + high) /2
            if (arr(mid) <= target) then
                pos = mid
                low = mid +1
            else
                high = mid-1
            end if
        end do
    end function find_last_le
    
    ! Function to find the insertion position for a value
    integer function find_insert_pos(arr, cnt, val) result(pos)
        integer, intent(in) :: arr(:), cnt, val
        integer :: low, high, mid
        pos = cnt +1
        low =1
        high = cnt
        do while (low <= high)
            mid = (low + high)/2
            if (arr(mid) <= val) then
                low = mid +1
            else
                pos = mid
                high = mid -1
            end if
        end do
    end function find_insert_pos
end program code_356A
